DOC.brief_title: Extended-Release Naltrexone Opioid Relapse Prevention Following Release From Jail
DOC.detailed_description: This protocol randomize person soon-to-be-released large urban jail treatment extended-release naltrexone ( XR-NTX ) , full opioid antagonist prevents activity heroin opioids . Investigators NYUSOM NYC DOHMH recruit heroin dependent person NYC jail soon-to-be-released , access opioid agonist pharmacotherapy , lower tolerance due incarceration , extremely likely relapse risk accidental overdose release . All N=40 participant receive two-session , individual psychosocial intervention , Motivational Interviewing . Half ( n=20 ) randomize pre-release treatment XR-NTX . Immediately one month follow release , participant offer continued psychosocial medication-assisted treatment ( naltrexone , buprenorphine , methadone ) Bellevue Hospital , include second XR-NTX dose among XR-NTX arm participant . The primary outcome relapse sustain opioid use first 30 day post-release . We hypothesize XR-NTX arm report significantly low rate sustain opioid relapse follow release .
